item.title: Cache
item.description: Cache (‘cash’) A reserved space location that collects temporary data that makes a device, browser, or app run faster and more efficiently After opening an app or website for the first time, a cache stashes files, images, and other pertinent data on the device. For every subsequent visit, the cached data will be quickly retrieved instead of locally redownloading the data every single time. 3 main areas of cache Devices and software The CPU, central processing unit, which is the core component responsible for processing information from the software in the desktop computer, laptop, smartphone or tablet, has its own cache.
